critique: This document is a withdrawal of public lands for the purpose of providing material for the construction and repair of public roads. It was issued in 1934. It does not seem to have a strong ideological tilt. It does not relate to immigration. It does not expand executive power in any significant way, as it is authorized by pre-existing legislation. It is difficult to assess its impact on federalism without more context, but it seems to be a fairly routine action. It does not directly relate to national security or civil liberties. It could be seen as a form of economic intervention, but it is a very minor one. It does not seem to have a significant impact on social inclusion.
